entry.value:
{"id":"0298fc97-b0c8-422f-bc29-2eb0aff86090","name":"HiltViewModel unresolved reference issue in LoginScreen","timestamp":1753381324896,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
<additional_data>
Below are some potentially helpful/relevant pieces of information for figuring out to respond
<current_file>
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/codinfinity/splity/features/auth/login/Login.kt, lines=ALL(1-70)
package com.codinfinity.splity.features.auth.login

import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Arrangement
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxSize
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.fillMaxWidth
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
import androidx.compose.material3.OutlinedCard
import androidx.compose.material3.OutlinedTextField
import androidx.compose.material3.Text
import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
import androidx.compose.runtime.collectAsState
import androidx.compose.ui.Alignment
import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
import androidx.compose.ui.text.style.TextAlign
import androidx.compose.ui.unit.dp
import androidx.navigation.NavController
import com.codinfinity.splity.ui.components.PrimaryButton

@Composable
fun LoginScreen(
 modifier: Modifier = Modifier,
 navController: NavController,
 viewModel: LoginViewModel = hiltViewModel()
) {
 val email = viewModel.email.collectAsState(initial = "")
 val password = viewModel.password.collectAsState(initial = "")
 Column(modifier = modifier.fillMaxSize(),
 horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,
 verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Center
 ) {
 OutlinedCard(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(16.dp),
 )
 {
 Text(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(16.dp),
 textAlign = TextAlign.Center,
 text = "Login")
 OutlinedTextField(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(16.dp),
 value = email.value,
 onValueChange = {
 viewModel.onEmailChange(it)
 },
 placeholder = { Text("Username") }
 )
 OutlinedTextField(
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(16.dp),
 value = password.value,
 onValueChange = {
 viewModel.onPasswordChange(it)
 },
 placeholder = { Text("Password")}
 )
 PrimaryButton(
 onClick = {
 viewModel.OnSignIn()
 },
 text = "Login",
 modifier = Modifier.fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(16.dp)
 )
 }
 }
}
```
</current_file>


<linter_errors>
## Linter Errors

Path: app/src/main/java/com/codinfinity/splity/features/auth/login/Login.kt
Errors:

Line 24: Unresolved reference 'hiltViewModel'.
</linter_errors>


<attached_files>
<file_contents>
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/codinfinity/splity/features/auth/login/Login.kt, lines=ALL(1-1)
hiltViewModel()
```
</file_contents>

</attached_files>
</additional_data>
<user_query>
why am I getting error for hiltViewModel()
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The error **Unresolved reference 'hiltViewModel'** means the hiltViewModel() function is not recognized in your Login.kt file. This commonly happens for one of these reasons:

### 1. Missing Import Statement
You need to import the hiltViewModel() function at the top of your Kotlin file. For Jetpack Compose with Hilt, the correct import is:

```kotlin
import androidx.hilt.navigation.compose.hiltViewModel
```

### 2. Missing Dependency
You need the Hilt Navigation Compose dependency in your build.gradle (Module). Make sure you have:

```groovy
implementation "androidx.hilt:hilt-navigation-compose:1.0.0"
```
(Version may differ; check for the latest stable version)

### 3. Missing Hilt Setup
Make sure that:
- Your Application class is annotated with @HiltAndroidApp.
- The relevant Gradle plugins for Hilt are applied.

---

**How to fix:** 
Add the following import at the top of your Login.kt file, just below your other imports:

```kotlin
import androidx.hilt.navigation.compose.hiltViewModel
```

Would you like me to add this import for you? If there are still errors after that, we can check your dependencies next."}]}]}

{"id":"0690ef98-d081-4a7a-9a7e-3186d0e9897d","name":"Clean Architecture Folder Structure Review","timestamp":1753295998260,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>
is my folder structure correct for clean architecture\
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Please provide the structure of your project’s folders and files so I can assess if it follows clean architecture principles."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>
core->services->api
data->
source-> remote,local
repository
domain->repository
features->screen,viewmodel,widgets
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Your structure generally fits clean architecture, but here are some suggestions for clarity and convention:

- core/services/api: Good for shared/core logic and services.
- data/source/remote,local: Good separation for data sources.
- data/repository: This should implement repository interfaces defined in domain/repository.
- domain/repository: Good for repository interfaces and business logic abstractions.
- features/screen,viewmodel,widgets: Nice for presentation/UI layer.

This structure is clean and separates concerns well. Ensure “domain” has only pure logic/interfaces, “data” implements “domain” contracts, and “features” contains UI and presentation logic."}]}]}

<user_query>
create a profilecard with an image placeholder and image and email
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To build a `ProfileCard` composable that displays an image placeholder (for when there's no image), an actual image (when available), and an email, I’ll update your composable using Jetpack Compose's best practices.

Here's the plan:

- The card will accept an `imageUrl` (nullable or string), an `email` string, and a `modifier`.
- If `imageUrl` is null or empty, display a placeholder (could be a default image or an icon).
- If `imageUrl` is provided, show the image (using Coil or similar library for loading).

Before updating your file, I’ll check if your project already uses an image loading library like Coil, or if we need to adjust for image loading setup."}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"call_PlF6W44KOwgxwtX9lJA9HhNq","type":"function","function":{"name":"grep_search","arguments":"{"query":"Coil","case_sensitive":false,"include_pattern":"*.kt","explanation":"Checking if Coil is imported or initialized anywhere, to determine if we can use it for image loading."}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"grep_search","tool_call_id":"call_PlF6W44KOwgxwtX9lJA9HhNq","content":"The grep_search tool found no files."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"call_yMFhbhgG5s4s48kUz97M72Qz","type":"function","function":{"name":"grep_search","arguments":"{"query":"AsyncImage","include_pattern":"*.kt","explanation":"Checking if the project already uses Coil's AsyncImage, as it's the common way to load images in Compose."}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"grep_search","tool_call_id":"call_yMFhbhgG5s4s48kUz97M72Qz","content":"The grep_search tool found no files."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"call_9oS18RcnNSHUMKQpsP8LSSxS","type":"function","function":{"name":"grep_search","arguments":"{"query":"Image(","include_pattern":"*.kt","explanation":"Searching for any use of the Compose Image() composable, which may indicate image handling patterns or placeholder approaches used in the codebase."}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"grep_search","tool_call_id":"call_9oS18RcnNSHUMKQpsP8LSSxS","content":"The grep_search tool found no files."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It looks like your project does not currently use an image loading library like Coil, nor are there existing usages of the Compose `Image()` function. For Jetpack Compose, Coil is the most common solution for loading images from URLs.

Here’s how I’ll proceed:

- I’ll update your `ProfileCard` so that it:
 1. Accepts `email: String` and `imageUrl: String?` parameters.
 2. Uses Coil’s `AsyncImage` for loading an image if the dependency is present, otherwise I'll show how to add it.
 3. Shows a placeholder (a default icon or color) if no image is available.
 4. Displays the email below the image.

Would you like me to:
- Add the Coil dependency to your project’s build.gradle if it’s missing?
- Or just update the composable code, assuming Coil will be set up?

Let me know which way you prefer!"}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"call_bZq1rHJbvcEjtZuTNOMgI9X3","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,9 +1,55 @@
 package com.codinfinity.splity.features.profile.widgets
 
+import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Arrangement
+import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.Column
+import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
+import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.size
+import androidx.compose.material.icons.Icons
+import androidx.compose.material.icons.filled.AccountCircle
+import androidx.compose.material3.Card
+import androidx.compose.material3.CardDefaults
+import androidx.compose.material3.Icon
+import androidx.compose.material3.MaterialTheme
+import androidx.compose.material3.Text
 import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
+import androidx.compose.ui.Alignment
 import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
+import androidx.compose.ui.unit.dp
+import coil.compose.AsyncImage
 
 @Composable
-fun ProfileCard(modifier: Modifier = Modifier) {
-
+fun ProfileCard(
+ email: String,
+ imageUrl: String?,
+ modifier: Modifier = Modifier
+) {
+ Card(
+ modifier = modifier,
+ elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(4.dp)
+ ) {
+ Column(
+ horizontalAlignment = Alignment.CenterHorizontally,
+ verticalArrangement = Arrangement.Center,
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(16.dp)
+ ) {
+ if (imageUrl.isNullOrBlank()) {
+ Icon(
+ imageVector = Icons.Default.AccountCircle,
+ contentDescription = "Profile Picture Placeholder",
+ modifier = Modifier.size(80.dp)
+ )
+ } else {
+ AsyncImage(
+ model = imageUrl,
+ contentDescription = "Profile Picture",
+ modifier = Modifier.size(80.dp)
+ )
+ }
+ Text(
+ text = email,
+ style = MaterialTheme.typography.bodyMedium,
+ modifier = Modifier.padding(top = 8.dp)
+ )
+ }
+ }
 }
```

The edit introduced the following new linter errors:

```
Line 18: Unresolved reference 'coil'.
Line 42: Unresolved reference 'AsyncImage'.
```

Please fix the linter errors if it is clear how to. Do not make uneducated guesses."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The following updates have been made:

1. The Coil Compose dependency (`io.coil-kt:coil-compose:2.6.0`) is added to your app-level `build.gradle.kts`.
2. The `ProfileCard` composable now:
 - Accepts `email` and `imageUrl` parameters.
 - Shows a placeholder icon when there’s no image URL, otherwise loads the image using `AsyncImage` from Coil.
 - Displays the email.

After syncing your Gradle files, the linter errors should resolve automatically since they’re caused by the new dependency not yet being available to the IDE/build system.

**Next step:** 
Sync your Gradle project to download the Coil library. Would you like to proceed with this now? If so, I can suggest the Gradle sync command for you to run."}]}]}

```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/codinfinity/splity/MainActivity.kt, lines=ALL(1-40)
package com.codinfinity.splity

import android.annotation.SuppressLint
import android.os.Build
import android.os.Bundle
import androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
import androidx.activity.compose.setContent
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import androidx.annotation.RequiresApi
import androidx.compose.foundation.layout.padding
import androidx.compose.material3.Scaffold
import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
import com.codinfinity.splity.ui.theme.SplityTheme
import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint
import io.github.jan.supabase.auth.Auth
import javax.inject.Inject

@SuppressLint("UnusedMaterial3ScaffoldPaddingParameter")
@AndroidEntryPoint
class MainActivity : ComponentActivity() {

 @Inject
 lateinit var auth: Auth

 @RequiresApi(Build.VERSION_CODES.O)
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 enableEdgeToEdge()

 setContent {
 SplityTheme {
 Scaffold {
 innerPadding ->
 SplityApp(modifier = Modifier.padding(innerPadding))
 }
 }
 }
 }
}

```
</file_contents>


<file_contents>
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/codinfinity/splity/features/navigation/NavGraph.kt, lines=ALL(1-90)
package com.codinfinity.splity.features.navigation

import BasicInfo
import android.annotation.SuppressLint
import android.os.Build
import androidx.annotation.RequiresApi
import androidx.compose.runtime.Composable
import androidx.compose.ui.Modifier
import androidx.navigation.NavHostController
import androidx.navigation.compose.NavHost
import androidx.navigation.compose.composable
import androidx.navigation.navDeepLink
import com.codinfinity.splity.HomeScreen
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.addFriend.AddFriend
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.auth.login.LoginScreen
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.auth.signUp.EmailVerificationScreen
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.auth.signUp.RegistrationComplete
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.auth.signUp.SignUpScreen
import com.codinfinity.splity.features.split.screens.SplitScreen

@RequiresApi(Build.VERSION_CODES.O)
@SuppressLint("ViewModelConstructorInComposable")
@Composable
fun AppNavGraph(navController: NavHostController,modifier:Modifier) {

 NavHost(
 navController = navController,
 startDestination = Screen.LoginScreen.route
 ) {
 composable (route = Screen.HomeScreen.route) {
 HomeScreen(navController = navController, modifier = modifier)
 }
 composable (route = Screen.LoginScreen.route){
 LoginScreen(
 navController = navController,
 modifier = modifier,
 )
 }
 composable (route = Screen.SignupScreen.route){
 SignUpScreen(
 navController = navController,
 modifier = modifier,
 )
 }
 composable(route= Screen.SplitScreen.route) {
 SplitScreen(
 navController = navController,
 modifier = modifier,
 )
 }
 composable(
 route = Screen.AddFriendScreen.route
 ) {
 AddFriend(
 modifier = modifier,
 )
 }

 composable(route = Screen.BasicInfoScreen.route) {
 BasicInfo(
 modifier = modifier,
 navController = navController
 )
 }
 composable(route = Screen.RegistrationCompleteScreen.route) {
 RegistrationComplete(
 modifier = modifier,
 navController = navController
 )
 }

 composable(
 route = Screen.EmailVerificationScreen.route,
 deepLinks = listOf(
 navDeepLink {
 uriPattern = "splity://auth-callback/{authToken}"
 action = "android.intent.action.VIEW"
 }
 )
 ) {
 backStackEntry ->
 val authToken = backStackEntry.arguments?.getString("authToken")
 EmailVerificationScreen(
 modifier = modifier,
 navController = navController
 )
 }

 }
}
```

@MainActivity.kt @NavGraph.kt @build.gradle.kts I am trying to create a deeplink but it is not working correctly and I am trying to use this command for the check
./adb shell am start -W -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d "splity://auth-callback/123" com.codifinity.splity
Starting: Intent { act=android.intent.action.VIEW dat=splity://auth-callback/... pkg=com.codifinity.splity }
Error: Activity not started, unable to resolve Intent { act=android.intent.action.VIEW dat=splity://auth-callback/... flg=0x10000000 pkg=com.codifinity.splity }
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thanks for sharing the details! You’ve set up the deep link in your `NavGraph.kt`, but the error you're getting indicates that Android can't resolve your intent—which almost always means that your `AndroidManifest.xml` does not declare an `<intent-filter>` for this URI and activity.

### Why Deep Link Isn't Working

Even though your Compose navigation is set up for deep linking, Android itself needs to know which activity can handle the URI before your app's navigation comes into play. This is controlled by your AndroidManifest.

Here’s the fix:

---

**1. Add an intent-filter in your `AndroidManifest.xml` to your `MainActivity`:**
Make sure this block is inside your MainActivity's `<activity>` tag.

```xml
<intent-filter>
 <action android:name="android.intent.action.VIEW" />

 <category android:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT" />
 <category android:name="android.intent.category.BROWSABLE" />

 <data
 android:scheme="splity"
 android:host="auth-callback"
 android:pathPattern=".*" />
</intent-filter>
```

This tells Android: 
- Any URL starting with `splity://auth-callback/...` 
- should launch `MainActivity` 
- and allow your Compose navigation to receive the deep link.

---

**2. Double-check the application ID:**
Your package in the command is `com.codifinity.splity`—but in `build.gradle.kts` it’s `com.codinfinity.splity` (with an **n**). 
If you use the wrong package, Android won't find the app. Ensure you use:
```bash
./adb shell am start -W -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d "splity://auth-callback/123" com.codinfinity.splity
```

---

**3. Clean and rebuild after manifest changes:**
Sometimes, manifest edits need a clean build or reinstall:
```bash
./gradlew clean assembleDebug
adb install -r app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk
```

---

**Summary Checklist:**
- [ ] Add an intent filter in Manifest as above.
- [ ] Use the correct applicationId in adb command.
- [ ] Clean & rebuild the app after changes.

---

Would you like me to add the correct `<intent-filter>` block to your `AndroidManifest.xml` for you?"}]}]}
